oai_dc:dc.dc:title: acclimation of birds in captivity
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lint, Kenton C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the past, the transportation of birds to Europeand to the United States from distant lands was a precariousundertaking, often encountering prolongedjourneys by sea on slow cargo boats and under theworse possible conditions. Many times birds werenetted, trapped and shipped before they had becomeaccustomed to an artificial diet. Packed in unsuitablecrates, with little light to see food or water providedenroute, hundreds of birds arrived dead, starved todeath. Other shipments were stowed below deck instifling conditions or stacked on the open deck, exposedto inclement weather or tied up in tropical portswhere heat exhaustion takes its toll.
